data.title: Always a good choice!
data.text: We enjoy dining here especially on Fridays and Saturdays for the live music upstairs at Fusion Lounge.  There are plenty of tables and food can also be served at the bar.  The atmosphere on the first floor is more intimate but the full menu is also available upstairs.  Always excellent food and service whichever space you chose to dine.  One excellent offering is free valet parking which is awesome during our cold weather!

data.title: Great dinner and service!
data.text: We were in town for the Packers game and had dinner at Chefusion. We found this restaurant on tripadvisor and were not disappointed.  The 3 course meal was great.  My Dad had the clam chowder soup and wanted to lick the bowl it was so good.  He had the seared blue fin tuna for his main dish. Then the lemon cake with ice cream for dessert.  I am a vegan, so I had salad, mushroom risotto and sorbet.  The main dishes were lukewarm in temperature but had great flavor.  There is a unsweetened sorbet as a palate cleanser between the 1st and 2nd courses. It was tart, but good. Before dinner the waiter delivered a small taste on a decorative spoon: It was a tenderloin of beef, with a roasted red pepper sauce, a small dollop of dill flavored cheese with a tiny basil leaf on top and a drop of aged balsamic vinegar.  Very elegant looking. It was a 2 hour dinner, but enjoyable conversation with the waiter and the owner/chef.  The valet parking is free.

data.title: Great meal and service!
data.text: We went on Saturday evening for our 25th Wedding Anniversary and we had a wonderful experience.  Unfortunately we had to do an earlier reservation that we wanted which left us being the only ones around our table for a while but the experience was great.  Food - it was a four course meal, Service - was excellent, Restaurant - clean and comfortable!  Definitely would recommend if you are looking for a nice place to go!

data.title: Loved the soup!
data.text: Dined here with business colleagues - small restaurant with larger bar area upstairs.  Excellent, attentive service.  I enjoyed the soup of the day but the entree was just ok.

data.title: Wonderful Evening
data.text:
Chefusion is the prefect name for this restaurant/fine dinning/bar/live music spot!
Its a wonderful blend of food and dinning styles.....
The lower level is a fine dinning restaurant, excellent food and a wonderful knowledgable staff. The upper level is a lively live music bar, more casual, huge bar, great food and well, live music. Reservations seem to be a must on weekends for the lower level, up stairs you just go right up! We look forward to returning!

data.title: Excellent well made food!
data.text: Very good food.  You can tell that care and thought has gone into the preparation of this food.  Unique for this area to say the least.  The atmosphere was upscale casual.  Wish they would actually have a dress code for downstairs in the dining room would make the food and service stand out even more.  Service was good for this type of restaurant.  Waitress was knowledgeable.  Good selection of main dishes.  Favorites of the 3 course meal were the seafood trio and the pumpkin bisque soup.  Delicious.  Would definitely go back again to try more.  Be ready to drop well over $125 per couple but worth it as a treat!!

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: In GB on business and went to Chefusion based on internet reviews. We were delighted with every delicious morsel and the service was terrific! We are looking forward to going out of our way to dine here again, when we're back in southeastern Wisconsin, because it was fantastic in every way.

data.title: Lambeau Field & Chefusion - Two Green Bay Gems
data.text:
We came to Green Bay to tour Lambeau Field. I'd read good reviews of Chefusion and decided to try it. It did not disappoint.

There are 2 levels - the restaurant downstairs and lounge upstairs. The lounge is louder and had all night happy hour the night we dined.  

Every dinner is a 3 course meal at minimum. Appetizer/salad, main and dessert.  I had the caprese with burrata which was wonderful. For the main, my husband has the char and I had the scallops. The scallops were served with delicious couscous. The char was very nice too. The best part of the meal was the lemon butter cake. It was one of the best desserts I have ever eaten. Definitely recommend it.

Our waiter was very congenial. The food was a bit slow in coming out, and he kept apologizing. 

If you want something a cut above a brew pub or Krolls, I highly recommend Chefusion.

data.title: Finally!!
data.text: We decided to come here based on Trip Advisor reviews and it did not disappoint! Wow! From the minute we stepped in to the minute we left it was a top notch experience. It was a 5 star meal at affordable prices. The food was so flavorful and beautifully presented. I'm a foodie so I appreciate all the little and big details!! Our waiter, Ross, was so friendly, helpful and extremely knowledgeable. The decor and ambiance was nice as well. Chairs were very comfortable....my husband is 6'4" and chairs are always an issue! It truly is great value for your money. Go hungry because portions are generous! I did the 3 courses: starting with the Caesar salad (best I've had), the tenderloin medallions in bordelaise sauce with garlic mashed potatoes and veggies. It's a stew and it was divine!! I finished off with the Opera cake, which was so beautiful and not super sweet. I was STUFFED! The rest of my party equally raved about their dishes as well. We will definitely return. You must try this restaurant.

data.title: Love this restaurant!
data.text: Im a foodie and this place is one of my favorites on Broadway! I love the different variety that they have to offer their. Their oysters are some of my favorite.

data.title: This isn't going out to eat, this is DINING
data.text: We decided we wanted to go someplace special for our anniversary.  We had eaten upstairs at Chefusion and loved it. But the occasion called for something quieter, even elegant, so we reserved downstairs.  Everything about our evening was extraordinary. Our waiter, James, was thoroughly knowledgable, helpful answering questions and making suggestions. They have a beautiful wine and special cocktail list.   I started with a lovely cocktail called RaRa. Shaken table side and served in a martini glass. Fabulous!  We both took the prix fixe 3-course menu.  I started with the mussels (best I've ever had) and my husband had the lobster bisque (said it was the best he ever had). John had the fresh catch of the day, a beautiful tuna served rare.  I had the lobster and pork belly served over ricotta gnocchi with a 65 degree egg.   It was to die for.  Our desserts were creme Brule and a turtle Sunday. Both were as exquisite as everything which preceded it.  I'm looking for an excuse to go back. This is fresh, creative dining at its best in a serene, refined setting. I highly recommend it.

data.title: Fancy & Casual in One!
data.text: I have always wanted to try out Chefusion but always thought I should only go for a special occasion because it's a higher end restaurant!  Long behold, there are two sections in the restaurant.  The downstairs, which serves your formal three course meal and the upstairs that has a more casual setting, which also serves the three course meals but has smaller plate options and items to share as well.  The best part is that the plates also feature smaller versions of the meals served on the formal menu, so you are still getting fabulous food!  It's great to know that this restaurant can be used for all occasions.

data.title: Awesome dinner!
data.text: The food is presented beautifully and so tasty!  Steak and seafood were both outstanding!  Our waiter, Ross was the best!  So attentive and personal!

data.title: Such a treat!
data.text: The food was exceptionally good!  Scallops were cooked to perfection - presentation was beautiful.  On line reservations are very helpful.

data.title: Fabulous
data.text: Three of us had a fabulous dinner here when we were in town for a conference. I started off with an excellent mojito. For dinner I had lobster bisque and pork belly ramen. My husband also had the bisque and filet mignon crostini--a huge portion considering that it was a "small plate."  My friend had the kobe meatloaf with ricotta gnocchi.. My friend and I split an opera cake and my husband finished with the strawberry three way dessert. Everything was wonderful, our waiter was very helpful, and the prices were surprisingly modest for gourmet fare. It was fun talking to the chef when he came out to greet his guests. I'm sorry the restaurant is so far from home. I'd definitely come here on a regular basis.

data.title: A surprise find
data.text: This gem in a small town like Green Bay is big city quality and choice. The menu is daunting in its vast array of choice, flavors and style. The price is more than reasonable and wine list honest and varied and more than that we'll priced. Go there and enjoy great food and wonderful service.

data.title: One of the Best Meals
data.text:
My wife and I made reservations (strongly recommended) and enjoyed a fantastic prix fixe meal. The foods are unique and delicious. My pork belly, lobster tail and 65 degree egg over bacon and cream gnocchi was incredible. My wife's pan fried Chilean sea bass and lemon risotto made me jealous that I didn't order that meal!

Before the meals, we enjoyed their bread service, with fresh rolls, olive oil and 25 year old balsamic vinegar, olive tapenade and roasted pepper hummus. That almost could be a meal in itself!

If you love food, go to Chefusion. It's just that simple.

Valet parking is available.

And they make excellent cocktails!

data.title: Very nice restaurant
data.text:
I visited Chefusion for the first time last night. We had a very good dining experience. The menu is varied with many choices. We were dining during Restaurant Week and thoroughly enjoyed our meal. Chef Tony designed a really creative menu for the week. Loved the mussels, best mussels I have had in a long time. I will definitely return to try again. I will now place Chefusion on my list of regular restaurants to visit. 

PS........we had excellent service.

data.title: Foodies will love it!
data.text: Excellent menu from Chef owner Tony Phillips, including gluten free options.   All employees have wonderful attitudes and I would highly recommend.

data.title: Everthing Great. Owner is fantastic
data.text: We had a great Father's Day dinner here. The place was a bit slow in the dining room, but the owner came out and talked to us and was very friendly. The waitstaff was very professional and knew the ins and outs of the menu. The food was superb and we are looking forward to going back when we're in Green Bay again!
